snippet: The actions of Tony Fernandes, the chief executive of the Malaysian company, have been compared favorably to the response of Malaysia Airlines earlier in 2014.
abstract: Handling of latest fatal AirAsia crash by chief executive Tony Fernandes has received far better public response than that by Malaysia Airlines for management of its disaster earlier in 2014; Fernandes addressed situation with the same compassionate, hands-on approach that has won him praise for his turnaround of AirAsia as a whole, which was deeply in debt and under state control 13 years earlier.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and NEIL GOUGH
byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong and Michael Forsythe from Putrajaya, Malaysia.

lead_paragraph: The actions of Tony Fernandes, the chief executive of the Malaysian company, have been compared favorably to the response of Malaysia Airlines earlier in 2014.

headline.main: AirAsia’s Chief Responds to Crisis With Quick Compassion
headline.print_headline: AirAsia’s Chief Responds Quickly and With Compassion
